intro: Cyphia elata f. flanagana, commonly known as the Flanagan's Cyphia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
